content:
I'd be happy to help you with script submission guidelines for theater festivals.

There are many theater festivals that accept script submissions, and each festival has its own set of guidelines and requirements. Here are a few general tips and some specific guidelines for some popular festivals:

**General Tips:**

1. **Read and follow the guidelines carefully**: Each festival has its own unique guidelines, so make sure you read and follow them carefully to avoid disqualification.
2. **Format your script correctly**: Use industry-standard playwriting software like Final Draft, Celtx, or Fade In, and follow the guidelines for formatting a play script.
3. **Edit and proofread your script**: Make sure your script is polished and error-free before submitting it.
4. **Research the festival**: Understand the festival's mission, target audience, and the types of plays they typically produce.
5. **Be prepared for a wait**: Script submission review processes can take several months, so be patient and don't expect immediate feedback.

**Specific Guidelines for Popular Festivals:**

Here are some guidelines for a few popular theater festivals:

1. **The Samuel French Off Off Broadway Short Play Festival**:
	* Submission window: usually December to February
	* Script length: 10-30 pages (10-30 minutes)
	* Format: Standard play script format
	* Submission fee: $20
	* [Website](https://www.samuelfrench.com/off-off-broadway-short-play-festival)
2. **The Humana Festival of New American Plays**:
	* Submission window: usually August to October
	* Script length: Full-length plays (at least 60 minutes)
	* Format: Standard play script format
	* Submission fee: None
	* [Website](https://www.actorstheatre.org/humana-festival/)
3. **The Kennedy Center's American College Theater Festival**:
	* Submission window: usually September to November
	* Script length: Full-length plays (at least 60 minutes)
	* Format: Standard play script format
	* Submission fee: None
	* [Website](https://www.kennedy-center.org/education/actf/)
4. **The New York International Fringe Festival (FringeNYC)**:
	* Submission window: usually October to December
	* Script length: Full-length plays (at least 60 minutes)
	* Format: Standard play script format
	* Submission fee: $40-$60
	* [Website](https://www.fringenyc.org/)
5. **The Playwrights' Center's Many Voices Fellowship**:
	* Submission window: usually January to March
	* Script length: Full-length plays (at least 60 minutes)
	* Format: Standard play script format
	* Submission fee: None
	* [Website](https://www.pwcenter.org/many-voices-fellowship)

These are just a few examples, and there are many more festivals that accept script submissions. Be sure to research each festival thoroughly and follow their specific guidelines.

Good luck with your script submissions!
